GapFillInput.Title: Words to describe feelings
GapFillInput.Instruction: Type a word or phrase to describe a feeling in each gap.

Content.Question:
1. She looked very happy and relaxed|excited on her wedding day.
2. John was very angry|annoyed because he stayed at home all day
but the electrician didn't come.
3. I was surprised|delighted when I passed the exam; I didn't believe it!
4. The children were so excited that they didn't sleep the day
before the party.
5. Marta was very nervous before her driving test.
6. I was very embarrassed because I couldn't remember his name.
7. Keri's mother was worried about her because she was very thin
and didn't eat much.
8. Sandra was very disappointed|upset that her friends couldn't come to her
party.
9. You seem in a good mood today!
10. Most of the students looked bored with the lesson and one
fell asleep!
11. My brother is scared|nervous|frightened of spiders.
12. I get very impatient|angry when I have to wait a long time on the
phone.
